info.title: Site Stacker API
info.description:
Visualize and try the Site Stacker API.

Authentication: The requests here are already authenticated if you're logged in into Site Stacker. For authentication see [http://docs.sitestacker.com/articles/api-authentication](http://docs.sitestacker.com/articles/api-authentication).

**CAUTION:** Any changes you make will be permanent.

tags.name: Activity
tags.description: Activities related to a CRM record (e.g. log a call, new task).

tags.name: Campaign
tags.description: Contribution campaigns (e.g. missionaries, projects, etc.).

tags.name: ContributionBatch
tags.description: A contribution batch represents a gift, split between one or multiple campaigns (contributions).

tags.name: HistoricGift
tags.description: Online and offline gifts used for generating reports and statements.

tags.name: Item
tags.description: An item represents a content item of a certain type, with translations and versions with dynamic fields.

tags.name: Newsletters
tags.description: Newsletter lists and subscribers.

tags.name: PaymentMethod
tags.description: A payment method is associated with a contribution batch.

tags.name: Person
tags.description: A person represents a CRM record.

tags.name: PersonAddress
tags.description: Addresses are associated to CRM records.

tags.name: PersonEmail
tags.description: A CRM record can have multiple emails.

tags.name: PersonFile
tags.description: A CRM record can have multiple files associated.

tags.name: PersonPhone
tags.description: A CRM record can have multiple phones.

tags.name: PersonRelation
tags.description: Relation between two CRM records.

tags.name: PersonType
tags.description: A CRM record can have multiple person (record) types.

tags.name: PersonEntity
tags.description: A CRM record can have multiple entities associated.

tags.name: PersonEntityData
tags.description:
An entity represents custom data associated with a CRM record. Entities and their structure are configured in `CRM > Configuration > Entities Tab`.
 These endpoints expose the entity data for a CRM record. To use them, you first need to have the entities configured in admin.

tags.name: Site
tags.description: Manage sites.

tags.name: Tag
tags.description: Manage tags.

tags.name: TagCategory
tags.description: Manage tag categories.

fullname.description: If not given, it will be constructed by concatenating `firstname` and `lastname`.

is_native.description: True if the gift originated in Site Stacker.

is_imported.description: True if the gift was imported. Usually for internal purposes.

donor_person_external_id.description: **Required if** `donor.id` is not set. The donor external id.

amount.description: Two decimal number without currency sign.

fund_id.description: **Required if** `receiver.id` is not set and you want the gift to be associated with a person. This field is mapped according to the Historic Giving component settings, in admin.

firstname.description: Donor first name. Will be populated if not set from `donor.id`.

lastname.description: Donor last name. Will be populated if not set from `donor.id`.

fullname.description: Donor or organization full name. Will be populated if not set from `donor.id`.

email.description: Donor email. Will be populated if not set from `donor.id`.

phone.description: Donor phone number. Will be populated if not set from `donor.id`.

latitude.description: The donor latitude, based on the address.

longitude.description: The donor longitude, based on the address.

address1.description: Donor address line 1. Will be populated if not set from `donor.id`.

address2.description: Donor address line 2. Will be populated if not set from `donor.id`.

city.description: Donor city. Will be populated if not set from `donor.id`.

zip.description: Donor zip / postal code. Will be populated if not set from `donor.id`.

state.description: Donor state code (preferred 2 letter code). Will be populated if not set from `donor.id`.

country.description: Donor country code (preferred 2 letter code). Will be populated if not set from `donor.id`.

affiliated_person_external_id.description: External system id for the affiliated donor.

affiliated_person_firstname.description: The affiliated donor first name, if the donor is an organization. Will be populated if not set from `affiliated_donor.id`.

affiliated_person_lastname.description: The affiliated donor last name, if the donor is an organization. Will be populated if not set from `affiliated_donor.id`.

affiliated_person_fullname.description: The affiliated donor full name, if the donor is an organization. Will be populated if not set from `affiliated_donor.id`.

affiliated_person_email.description: The affiliated donor email, if the donor is an organization. Will be populated if not set from `affiliated_donor.id`.

donor_person_virtuous_id.description: Virtuous contact individual id of the donor.

donor_household_virtuous_id.description: Virtuous contact id of the donor. For internal use.

donor.description: **Required if** `donor.external_id` is not set. The donor Site Stacker person id.

sitestackerSignature.description: HMAC hex digest of the payload, using the hooks secret as the key (if configured).

requestId.name: Request-Id
requestId.description: This can be used to prevent request cycle loops.

Accept-Ranges.description: A comma-separated list with all possible columns for ordering. E.g. `id, name`

Content-Range.description: Specifies the order, range, limit and total number of items. E.g. `id 0..; max=3, total=4, order=asc`

Next-Range.description: Specifies the next range (similar to Content-Range). E.g. `id 3..4; max=3, order=asc`

RateLimit-Limit.description: Request limit per hour. This header is present in all requests.

RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window. This header is present in all requests.

RateLimit-Reset.description: The server date/time at which the current rate limit window resets. This header is present in all requests.

206.description: Partial Content. Returned if there are other items left (considering pagination). Use Next-Range to get next list of items. The content is the same as 200 OK.

403.description: RequestTimeTooSkewed. This happens when the difference between the request date and the current date is too large. See [http://docs.sitestacker.com/articles/api-authentication#time-stamp-requirement](http://docs.sitestacker.com/articles/api-authentication#time-stamp-requirement).

2xx_webhook.description: To acknowledge receipt of a webhook, your endpoint should return a 2xx HTTP status code.

5xx_webhook.description: Any 5xx HTTP status code indicates to Site Stacker that you did not receive the webhook, so it will retry sending it 10 times every minute.

patch.summary: Merge a CRM record into another one
patch.description: Merges the {person} CRM record into {destination} and deletes the {person} record.

parameters.name: person
parameters.description: The person id that will be merged.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The person id that will be merged into.

requestBody.description: Json-encoded rules object. This is optional, if not given it will keep the destination record and combine all records that can be combined (e.g. gifts).

title.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

firstname.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

middlename.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

lastname.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

suffix.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

gender.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

birthday.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

email.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

description.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

is_group.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

fullname.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

external_id.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

virtuous_id.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

household_name.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

household_external_id.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

household_virtuous_id.description: `0` means it will keep the destination record unchanged. Set to `1` to replace the value with the one from the merged record.

user.description: Don't specify this field if you want to keep whatever user record exists, if only 1 exists, on any person record.

entity_ConferenceRegistrarion.description: `0` means it will only keep the entities from the destination record. Set to `1` to combine the entities from both records.

entity_CustomerSatisfactionSurvey.description: `0` means it will only keep the entities from the destination record. Set to `1` to combine the entities from both records.

entity_JobInfo.description: `0` means it will only keep the entities from the destination record. Set to `1` to combine the entities from both records.

entity_JobInformation.description: `0` means it will only keep the entities from the destination record. Set to `1` to combine the entities from both records.

entity_MyWmtek.description: `0` means it will only keep the entities from the destination record. Set to `1` to combine the entities from both records.

entity_TellUAboutYourProject.description: `0` means it will only keep the entities from the destination record. Set to `1` to combine the entities from both records.
